description_txt: stated on January 22, 2012 in an interview on “Meet the Press”:
quote_txt: Says the New York Giants "train in New Jersey, they play in New Jersey and most of their players live in New Jersey."

description_txt: stated on December 14, 2011 in a speech.:
quote_txt: "Chesterfield has eliminated more positions from its general government operations than the Commonwealth has from the entire state government since (fiscal) 2009."

description_txt: stated on December 30, 2011 in an interview with the Union City Daily Messenger :
quote_txt: "Studies show that if we opened one reserve in Alaska now, in five years, gas prices could be at $2 a gallon."

description_txt: stated on January 7, 2012 in a press release:
quote_txt: "Congressman Phil Roe hands out $1.3M government check" from a federal program that "he voted against."

description_txt: stated on January 21, 2012 in an opinion column:
quote_txt: "Martin Luther King was a Republican."
footer: By C. Eugene Emery Jr. • January 29, 2012

description_txt: stated on January 26, 2012 in a Republican presidential debate in Jacksonville, Fla.:
quote_txt: "In 2006, I went out and authored a letter with 24 other senators asking for major reform of Freddie and Fannie, warning of a meltdown and a bubble in the housing market."

description_txt: stated on January 26, 2012 in a debate in Jacksonville, Fla.:
quote_txt: "This president went before the United Nations and castigated Israel for building settlements. He said nothing about thousands of rockets being rained in on Israel from the Gaza Strip."

description_txt: stated on January 26, 2012 in a Republican presidential debate in Jacksonville, Fla.:
quote_txt: "I've never voted for a Democrat when there was a Republican on the ballot."

description_txt: stated on December 12, 2011 in a Web post.:
quote_txt: "Eric Holder is supportive of the NAACP's efforts to get the United Nations involved in our elections."

description_txt: stated on January 26, 2012 in a Republican presidential primary debate:
quote_txt: "Romneycare … is a top-down, government-run health care system."

description_txt: stated on January 26, 2012 in a Republican presidential debate in Jacksonville, Fla.:
quote_txt: "We balanced the budget with the 1997 Balanced Budget Act, and ultimately had four consecutive balanced budgets."

description_txt: stated on January 10, 2012 in a newspaper column.:
quote_txt: "The U.S. gun homicide rate is 20 times the combined rate of other western nations."

description_txt: stated on January 15, 2012 in a speech at the Cuban Club in Elizabeth:
quote_txt: "Our jobless rate, our unemployment rate, is the lowest of all of the big cities in New Jersey."

description_txt: stated on January 10, 2012 in an interview with The Plain Dealer:
quote_txt: Says Ohio has 77 job training programs spread across 13 state agencies.

description_txt: stated on January 19, 2012 in the State of the City address:
quote_txt: "We have cut crime across every single zone in the city of Atlanta by between 10 percent and 16 percent, depending on the zone."

description_txt: stated on January 24, 2012 in a television ad:
quote_txt: "Romneycare sent costs spiraling out of control" in Massachusetts, "hiking premiums, squeezing household budgets."

description_txt: stated on January 26, 2012 in a graphic circulating on the Internet:
quote_txt: Republican-leaning states get more in federal dollars than they pay in taxes.

description_txt: stated on January 19, 2012 in a television ad:
quote_txt: Nevada is No. 1 in unemployment, violent crime, car theft, divorce, robberies and foreclosures.

description_txt: stated on January 24, 2012 in a Republican response to the State of the Union address:
quote_txt: Says Steve Jobs was responsible for creating more jobs than the stimulus bill.

description_txt: stated on December 14, 2011 in a press release:
quote_txt: "Before this day is out, 18 more veterans will have taken their own lives.  That is the daily average, it is intolerable, and it has to stop."

description_txt: stated on January 11, 2012 in a speech.:
quote_txt: Gov. McDonnell's proposed budget "is cutting" public education.

description_txt: stated on January 18, 2012 in a campaign commercial:
quote_txt: "For the first time in 13 years, our dependence on foreign oil is below 50 percent."

description_txt: stated on January 11, 2012 in a news conference:
quote_txt: The InterLink at T.F. Green Airport is the closest air-rail link in the country.

description_txt: stated on January 24, 2012 in a prepared statement:
quote_txt: Says Mitt Romney "was one of the first national Republican leaders to endorse" Marco Rubio.

description_txt: stated on January 25, 2012 in a Spanish-language radio ad:
quote_txt: Says Newt Gingrich said "Spanish is the language of the ghetto."

description_txt: stated on November 3, 2011 in a speech on the floor of the U.S. House of Representatives.:
quote_txt: The United States is no longer "top nation in the globe on infrastructure," having fallen to 15th.

description_txt: stated on January 24, 2012 in a Republican response to the State of the Union address:
quote_txt: "Nearly half of all persons under 30 did not go to work today."

description_txt: stated on January 23, 2012 in comments to reporters in Tampa, Fla.:
quote_txt: "(Newt Gingrich) voted in favor of establishing the Department of Education, and yet he gets in a debate and says we should get rid of the Department of Education and send all the education issues back to the states."

description_txt: stated on January 24, 2012 in the State of the Union address:
